sections.title: Official Properties Panel
items: Replaced custom properties panel with official bpmn-js-properties-panel v5.50.1
Full Camunda/Operaton property editing: name, ID, documentation, async continuations, inputs/outputs, listeners, extension properties
BusinessRuleTask properties: decision reference, result variable, map decision result
UserTask properties: form key, assignee, candidate users/groups

sections.title: DMN Linking for BusinessRuleTasks
items: Link to DMN selector appears in properties panel when a BusinessRuleTask is selected
Dropdown populated with all individual DMNs available on the active TriplyDB endpoint via /v1/dmns
Selecting a DMN auto-populates camunda:decisionRef, camunda:resultVariable and camunda:mapDecisionResult
Visual badge overlays on canvas show the linked DMN identifier on each BusinessRuleTask
Badges dynamically centered on the element regardless of task width

sections.title: Enhanced Tree Felling Permit Example
items: Updated example BPMN with embedded HTML forms (start-form.html, inform-applicant-form.html)
Added script tasks for setting process variables after permit and rejection decisions
Pre-linked BusinessRuleTasks with DMN references visible as badges on load

sections.title: Semantic Analysis Tab
items: New 'Semantic Analysis' tab in the Chain Builder alongside the existing 'Chain Builder' tab
Detects semantically equivalent DMN variables across agencies via shared skos:exactMatch URIs
Suggests cross-agency DMN chain connections where variables differ in name but share the same concept
Counts and distinguishes semantic matches from exact identifier matches
Displays matching path: output concept ‚Üí skos:exactMatch ‚Üí input concept with variable identifiers and notations

sections.title: Backend Semantic Matching APIs
items: GET /api/dmns/semantic-equivalences ‚Äî finds all variable pairs sharing a skos:exactMatch URI across DMNs
GET /api/dmns/enhanced-chain-links ‚Äî combines exact identifier matching with semantic concept matching
GET /api/dmns/cycles ‚Äî detects 3-hop circular dependencies in DMN chains via semantic links
All new endpoints support the existing ?endpoint= parameter for dynamic TriplyDB dataset selection
New TypeScript types: SemanticEquivalence, EnhancedChainLink, ConceptInfo, ChainCycle

sections.title: Graph View Enhancement
items: Semantic links (skos:exactMatch, dct:subject) rendered with dashed green lines in the graph visualization
Semantic links use thicker stroke (2.5px) vs standard links (1.5px) for visual distinction

sections.title: Resolved intermittent CORS issues
items: Fixed CORS preflight handling to ensure consistent behavior across all supported origins and browsers
Explicitly applied CORS configuration to OPTIONS requests to prevent cached preflight mismatches
Hardened CORS origin validation for improved reliability in multi-environment deployments

sections.title: Core BPMN Functionality
items: Added interactive BPMN 2.0 process editor with drag-and-drop interface powered by bpmn-js v18.12.0
Full element palette: start/end events, tasks, gateways, subprocesses, data objects, pools, annotations
Three-panel layout: process list (left), canvas editor (middle), properties panel (right)
Mouse wheel zoom (scroll to zoom), zoom controls (+/-/fit-to-viewport), and smooth canvas interactions
Support for BusinessRuleTasks with camunda:decisionRef attributes for DMN integration with Operaton engine

sections.title: Process Management
items: Create unlimited BPMN processes with localStorage persistence (survives browser refresh)
Double-click process names to rename, delete with confirmation dialog
Auto-save functionality preserves changes across sessions
Export processes as .bpmn XML files compatible with Camunda/Operaton engines
Close button returns to empty state, allowing quick process switching

sections.title: Example & Documentation
items: Tree Felling Permit example process auto-loads on first visit
Demonstrates complete workflow: user tasks, BusinessRuleTasks (DMN), gateways, conditional flows
Example protected from deletion with 'EXAMPLE' badge and disabled delete button
References TreeFellingDecision and ReplacementTreeDecision DMN models
Serves as reference implementation for government service workflows

sections.title: Properties & Configuration
items: Properties panel shows element type, ID, and editable name field
DMN Decision Reference section for BusinessRuleTasks (decisionRef, resultVariable inputs)
Real-time property updates synchronized with canvas
Custom CSS fixes for rendering artifacts (eliminated black circles/lines during connection dragging)
Integrated camunda-bpmn-moddle v7.0.1 for Camunda namespace support (Operaton compatible)

sections.title: Technical Implementation
items: TypeScript interfaces: BpmnProcess with id, name, xml, timestamps, linkedDmnTemplates, readonly flag
BpmnService class for localStorage CRUD operations (getProcesses, saveProcess, deleteProcess, getProcess)
Default BPMN XML templates including empty process and Tree Felling Permit example
Custom wheel event handler overrides default Ctrl+Scroll requirement for intuitive zooming
Component structure: BpmnModeler, BpmnCanvas, BpmnProperties, ProcessList, DmnTemplateSelector (placeholder)

sections.title: Query Library & Data Quality
items: Added 'Service Rules Metadata' query to retrieve cprmv:Rule ‚Üí eli:LegalResource ‚Üí cpsv:PublicService relationships
Query returns ruleIdPath, ruleDefinition, ruleSituatie, and ruleNorm organized by service identifier
Leverages new cprmv:implements property for direct semantic linking (eliminates fragile string matching)

sections.title: Export & Usability
items: Added working 'Export CSV' button to Query Editor results view
CSV export includes proper escaping for commas, quotes, and newlines
Timestamped filenames (e.g., sparql-results-2026-02-06.csv) for easy organization

sections.title: Data Quality Improvements
items: Identified and resolved RDF URI collision issue causing rule merging in TriplyDB
CPSV Editor now generates unique URIs for each cprmv:Rule instance
Coordinated with CPSV Editor project to add explicit cprmv:Rule ‚Üí eli:LegalResource links
Eliminated need for string-based rulesetId matching in favor of semantic RDF relationships

sections.title: Test Data & Multi-Endpoint Improvements
items: Automatic test data population from RDF schema:value in TTL files - inputs now pre-fill with example values defined in metadata
Fixed chain execution with dynamic endpoints - DMNs from any TriplyDB dataset can now be executed, not just the default endpoint
Backend endpoint parameter support throughout execution flow (API ‚Üí orchestration ‚Üí SPARQL service)
Intelligent test data fallback: uses RDF values when available, falls back to testData.json for legacy DMNs

sections.title: Chain Execution Fixes
items: Fixed chain execution with non-default endpoints - backend now uses correct endpoint cache when looking up DMNs
Added endpoint parameter to chain execution API flow (frontend ‚Üí backend ‚Üí orchestration service)
DMNs from any TriplyDB dataset can now be executed successfully, not just the default endpoint

sections.title: User-Created Templates
items: 'Save as Template' button to save current chain configurations as reusable templates
Templates stored in browser localStorage with automatic endpoint-specific scoping
Save modal with template name and description fields
Validation enforcement - only valid chains can be saved as templates
Templates automatically save chain structure, DMN sequence, and input values

sections.title: Template Management
items: User templates displayed in separate 'My Templates' section
Delete functionality for user-created templates with confirmation dialog
Templates persist across browser sessions
Each endpoint maintains its own isolated template collection
Category filter supports 'Custom' option to show only user templates

sections.title: UX Improvements
items: Clear visual separation between 'Example Templates' (predefined) and 'My Templates' (user-created)
Template cards show complexity badges and estimated execution time
Delete button (trash icon) on user template cards
Save button disabled state with helpful tooltip when chain is invalid

sections.title: UX Improvements
items: Search input field - Located below the 'Available DMNs' header with search icon
Real-time filtering - Searches across:
DMN identifier (e.g., 'heusden-pas')
Description text
Input variable names
Output variable names

sections.title: Cache Management
items: Refresh button in Orchestration view for instant cache clearing (no more 5-minute wait for newly published DMNs)
GET /api/cache/stats endpoint to view cache age and entry count per endpoint
DELETE /api/cache/clear endpoint to programmatically clear specific or all endpoint caches
GET /api/dmns?refresh=true query parameter to bypass cache and fetch fresh data
Response now includes 'fromCache' field for debugging cache behavior

sections.title: Developer Experience
items: Demo-ready: Published DMNs appear immediately after clicking Refresh Cache
Backwards compatible: Existing 5-minute cache TTL still works by default
Cache statistics API for monitoring and debugging cache performance
Per-endpoint cache isolation ensures multi-dataset workflows remain efficient

sections.title: Dynamic Endpoints
items: Switch between TriplyDB datasets without page reload
Per-endpoint backend caching (5-minute TTL per dataset)
Connection status indicators (Direct/Proxied)
Session endpoint management (save, switch, delete, reset)
Optional ?endpoint= query parameter on /v1/dmns API

sections.title: Chain Export
items: Export chains to JSON (configuration) and BPMN 2.0 (process diagram) formats
Export button with validation - only enabled for valid chains
Modal dialog with filename customization and format selection
Operaton namespace integration (open-source Camunda fork)
BPMN 2.0 compliant with proper extensionElements structure
2-step deployment instructions in README
DMN XML fetching from Operaton
DMN metadata preservation (IDs, titles, descriptions) in BPMN exports

sections.title: CI/CD Automation
items: GitHub Actions workflows for automated front- & backend deployment (production + acceptance)
Manual approval workflow for production backend deployments via GitHub environment protection
Automated health checks post-deployment with retry logic (5 attempts, 10s intervals)
Environment-specific build commands (build:prod, build:acc)
Deployment history tracking in GitHub Actions
One-click rollback capabilities via Azure Portal

sections.title: Environment Configuration
items: Three distinct frontend .env files (development, acceptance, production)
Environment-specific backend NODE_ENV (acceptance vs production)
Proper CORS configuration for each environment
Separate API endpoint URLs for local, ACC, and production
Azure App Settings management via CLI and Portal

sections.title: Infrastructure
items: Production backend deployed to backend.linkeddata.open-regels.nl
Acceptance backend deployed to acc.backend.linkeddata.open-regels.nl
Azure App Service (Node.js 22) for both backend environments
Azure Static Web Apps for frontend (both environments)
Custom domain configuration with HTTPS for all endpoints
Health monitoring endpoints with TriplyDB and Operaton connectivity status

sections.title: Tutorial System
items: In-app tutorial system with 5 comprehensive guides (36 total steps)
Quick Start: Heusdenpas Chain Demo - Step-by-step first execution (10 steps)
Building Chains Manually - Drag-and-drop workflow guide (7 steps)
Understanding DMN Models - Decision model concepts explained (6 steps)
Advanced Features - SPARQL, graphs, performance monitoring (7 steps)
Troubleshooting Guide - Common issues and solutions (6 steps)
Accordion navigation: only one tutorial open at a time
Auto-scroll behavior: tutorials automatically position at top when opened
Quick jump buttons for instant navigation between tutorials
10-term glossary with key definitions (DMN, SPARQL, CPRMV, etc.)
Accessible via new Help icon (?) in sidebar navigation
Full-width view with collapsible sections
JSON-configurable content for easy future updates

sections.title: UX Improvements
items: Deployment metadata display in Chain Builder (API endpoint + deployment ID)
Incremental test data system for step-by-step demonstrations
DMN query library integration without auto-view switching
Enhanced error reporting with screenshots and console logs
Preset loading UI restored in Chain Configuration panel
Fixed DMN card removal to properly clear configuration state

sections.title: Bug Fixes
items: Enhanced error messages to show specific deployment and Operaton errors
Synchronized test data between current preset and manual chain
Fixed execution progress visibility on first run
Missing Metadata (Definition Key, Deployment ID, API Endpoint)
Incremental Test Data for Demo (only worked for complete chain)
All 5 DMN queries now visible in Library view

sections.title: Phase B.3 - Chain Builder UI
items: Visual drag-and-drop chain builder interface
Real-time chain validation with input requirements
Dynamic form generation for DMN inputs
Test data filling for rapid testing
Chain execution with progress tracking
Results display with execution timing
Step-by-step execution breakdown
Frontend-backend integration via REST API

sections.title: Phase B.2 - Backend Orchestration Service (Complete)
items: Node.js/Express REST API backend
TriplyDB SPARQL integration
Operaton DMN execution integration
Variable mapping and orchestration logic
Azure App Service deployment (ACC environment)
Structured logging with Winston
CORS configuration for frontend integration

sections.title: Phase B.1 - Backend Orchestration Service
items: Added DMN discovery via SPARQL queries with cprmv vocabulary support
Three-panel orchestration view: DMN list, chain builder placeholder, and details panel
Search and filter DMN models by name or identifier in real-time
View DMN input variables (blue cards) and output variables (green cards) with types
Discover DMN chains automatically where output of DMN1 matches input of DMN2
Display chain connections and variable mappings with visual indicators
Smart query library filtering - shows only relevant queries per view mode
Phase B.3 placeholder for visual drag-and-drop chain builder

sections.title: SPARQL Enhancements
items: Added cprmv (CPSV Rule Model) vocabulary prefix for decision models
Added schema.org vocabulary prefix for additional metadata
5 new DMN-specific SPARQL queries: Find All DMNs, Input/Output Details, Find Chains, Chain Paths, Complete Metadata
Intelligent SPARQL result parsing handles multiple query response formats

sections.title: Architecture & UI
items: New ViewMode.ORCHESTRATION enum value for navigation state
5 new TypeScript interfaces: DmnModel, DmnVariable, DmnChainLink, DmnChain, OrchestrationState
OrchestrationView component with automatic query type detection
4th navigation button (GitBranch icon) for orchestration workflows
Consistent design language with existing components using Tailwind CSS

sections.title: Core Features
items: React-based SPARQL visualization and query tool
Interactive graph visualization using D3.js force simulation
Support for multiple SPARQL endpoints (configurable)
Real-time query execution with loading states
Zoom and pan capabilities for graph exploration

sections.title: SPARQL Features
items: Built-in SPARQL query editor with syntax support
Sample query library for quick testing
Support for SELECT queries with visual results
Automatic graph detection for ?s ?p ?o patterns
CORS proxy support for public endpoints

sections.title: Visualization
items: Force-directed graph layout for RDF triples
Color-coded nodes: Subjects (blue), Objects (amber), Literals (green)
Interactive node dragging and positioning
Edge labels showing predicates/relationships
Responsive canvas that adapts to window size

sections.title: User Interface
items: Modern design with Tailwind CSS
Dark sidebar navigation with mode switching
Tabular results view for query data
Settings panel for endpoint management
Error handling with user-friendly messages

sections.title: Technical Stack
items: Built with React 19 and TypeScript
Vite for fast development and building
D3.js v7 for data visualization
Lucide React for consistent iconography
ESLint 9 with modern flat config for code quality

sections.title: Code Quality
items: Full TypeScript type safety throughout codebase
ESLint configuration with zero warnings
Prettier for consistent code formatting
Husky git hooks for pre-commit linting
lint-staged for fast pre-commit checks

sections.title: Deployment
items: Deployed to Azure Static Web Apps
Custom domain: linkeddata.open-regels.nl
Automatic CI/CD via GitHub Actions
Environment: acc.linkeddata.open-regels.nl for testing
